intro: Licania costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican licania, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
